Welcome to weatherservice’s documentation!¶

The WeatherService library offers access to the National Weather Service for the United States. You can either get information via latitude and longitude, or by passing in an address (which will be geocoded through Google). This library can work online (connected) or offline (disconnected). When offline, only certain addresses are available.

>>> from weatherservice import weatherservice
>>> weatherservice.connect()
>>> report = weatherservice.get_report("New York, NY")
>>> report
<weatherservice.weatherservice.Report object>
>>> report.weather.temp
41
>>> weatherservice.get_report("Tokoyo, China")
weatherservice.weatherservice.WeatherException: This city was outside of the continental United States.
>>> weatherservice.disconnect()
>>> weatherservice.get_report("New York, NY").weather.temp
88
>>> weatherservice.get_report("Newark, DE")
weatherservice.weatherservice.GeocodeException: The given city was not in the cache.

Methods¶

weatherservice.connect()¶

Connect to the online data source in order to get up-to-date information. :returns: void

weatherservice.disconnect(filename='weatherservice/cache.json')¶

Connect to the local cache, so no internet connection is required. :returns: void

weatherservice.get_report(address)¶

Gets a report on the current weather, forecast, and more detailed information about the location.

Parameters:address (str) – A location (e.g., “Newark, DE”) somewhere in the United States
Returns:lat, long
weatherservice.get_report_by_latlng(latitude, longitude)¶

Gets a report on the current weather, forecast, and more detailed information about the location.

Parameters:
  • latitude (float) – The latitude (up-down) of the location to get information about.
  • longitude (float) – The longitude (left-right) of the location to get information about.
Returns:

Report

Data Classes¶

class weatherservice.Report(weather, forecasts, location)¶

A container for the weather, forecasts, and location information.

__init__(weather, forecasts, location)¶

Creates a new Report

Parameters:
  • self (Report) – This object
  • weather (Weather) – The current weather for this location.
  • forecasts (listof Forecast) – The forecast for the next 7 days and 7 nights.
  • location (Location) – More detailed information on this location.
Returns:

Report
class weatherservice.Weather(temp, dewpoint, humidity, wind_speed, wind_direction, description, image_url, visibility, windchill, pressure)¶

A structured representation the current weather.

__init__(temp, dewpoint, humidity, wind_speed, wind_direction, description, image_url, visibility, windchill, pressure)¶

Creates a new Weather

Parameters:
  • self (Weather) – This object
  • temp (int) – The current temperature (in Fahrenheit).
  • dewpoint (int) – The current dewpoint temperature (in Fahrenheit).
  • humidity (int) – The current relative humidity (as a percentage).
  • wind_speed (int) – The current wind speed (in miles-per-hour).
  • wind_direction (int) – The current wind direction (in degrees).
  • description (string) – A human-readable description of the current weather.
  • image_url (string) – A url pointing to a picture that describes the weather.
  • visibility (float) – How far you can see (in miles).
  • windchill (int) – The perceived temperature (in Fahrenheit).
  • pressure (float) – The barometric pressure (in inches).
Returns:

Weather
class weatherservice.Location(latitude, longitude, elevation, name)¶

A detailed description of a location

__init__(latitude, longitude, elevation, name)¶

Creates a new Location

Parameters:
  • self (Location) – This object
  • latitude (float) – The latitude (up-down) of this location.
  • longitude (float) – The longitude (left-right) of this location.
  • elevation (int) – The height above sea-level (in feet).
  • name (string) – The city and state that this location is in.
Returns:

Location
class weatherservice.Forecast(period_name, period_time, temperature_label, temperature, probability_of_precipitation, description, image_url, long_description)¶

A prediction for future weather.

__init__(period_name, period_time, temperature_label, temperature, probability_of_precipitation, description, image_url, long_description)¶

Creates a new Forecast

Parameters:
  • self (Forecast) – This object
  • period_name (string) – A human-readable name for this time period (e.g. Tonight or Saturday).
  • period_time (string) – A string representing the time that this period starts. Encoded as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS, where the T is not a number, but a always present character (e.g. 2013-07-30T18:00:00).
  • temperature_label (string) – Either ‘High’ or ‘Low’, depending on whether or not the predicted temperature is a daily high or a daily low.
  • temperature (int) – The predicted temperature for this period (in Fahrenheit).
  • probability_of_precipitation (int) – The probability of precipitation for this period (as a percentage).
  • description (string) – A human-readable description of the predicted weather for this period.
  • image_url (string) – A url pointing to a picture that describes the predicted weather for this period.
  • long_description (string) – A more-detailed, human-readable description of the predicted weather for this period.
Returns:

Forecast
